intro: Ardisia venosissima, commonly known as the veiny evergreen ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with prominent veins, which give it its common name. It produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers followed by bright red berries. Ardisia venosissima is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
